source: 他引用的都是他的亲戚。
correct reference: All of the person he appointed were his relatives.
incorrect reference: All of the person he quoted were his relatives.

This sentence construction means that the subject is limiting the scope of what they cite to only their relatives. 'Only' is an important modifier to emphasize that he cites nothing but his relatives which is captured well by the translation 'only.' Furthermore, his relatives are clearly identified by the modifier 他的 (his), which is translated accurately as 'his relatives'. Therefore, the most accurate and faithful translation of the Chinese sentence “他引用的都是他的亲戚。” is 'He only cites his relatives.'
